- Rabatte: Vorrat begrenzt. Die tatsächlichen Einsparungen hängen von der Verfügbarkeit der Produkte ab.

Bei Käufen im Microsoft Store finden Sie weitere Informationen in den geltenden Microsoft-Verkaufsbedingungen. - Niedrigpreisversprechen: Gültig für den Kauf von Hardware-Produkten über die Microsoft Store-Website mit einem gültigen Microsoft-Konto und in Microsoft Experience Centern in ausgewählten Märkten für 60 Tage ab dem Tag, an dem die Kundin/der Kunde das Produkt erhält („Angebotszeitraum“). Ausgenommen Surface Hub, HoloLens und Windows DevKit. Kund*innen haben nur dann Anspruch, wenn der Preis des gekauften Produkts während des Angebotszeitraums reduziert wurde und das Produkt zum Kauf vorrätig ist. Bei Käufen im Microsoft Store wenden Sie sich bitte an den Microsoft Store-Vertrieb und -Support und geben Sie die Daten zu Ihrem Microsoft-Konto sowie alle weiteren Informationen an, die vom Store-Vertriebspersonal angefragt werden. What is a digital whiteboard?
Whether you’re presenting slides in front of an audience or brainstorming on a whiteboard, visual collaboration tools help people solve problems together, make discussions more engaging, and invite teamwork as people spontaneously share ideas.
But what if you aren’t all in the same room?
A digital whiteboard can help. It’s an online virtual space where your team can share notes, files, and photos, just like a physical whiteboard—except it’s accessible anywhere with internet access. (That’s why it’s also called an online whiteboard and virtual whiteboard.) It combines the best parts of a physical whiteboard, like text and sticky notes, with digital features like screenshots and autosave, so you never have to worry about someone erasing your ideas.

Guide to AI summarizer and note-taking tools
AI systems have been around—believe it or not—since the 1950s. And there have been major strides in AI tool development, such as speech and image recognition and language understanding, in the last two decades.
The market for AI spans industries and is expected to grow to almost $740 billion in 2030, according to Statista. It’s increasingly common to see AI in the workplace in the form of apps, chatbots, and image-generation, and it’s transforming traditional job duties like note-taking as well.
Note-taking has transcended conventional methods and become more intuitive, efficient, and personalized—and AI summarizers, AI transcription, and AI note-taking technologies are changing the way people capture, organize, and retrieve information. In this article, you’ll learn about using AI to take notes, how the technology works, popular tools, and the impact it has on productivity and learning.
What is AI note-taking?
AI note-taking is the process of using AI technologies, algorithms, and language models to enhance and streamline the process of taking, organizing, and managing notes. While traditional note-taking methods involve manually writing or typing information, AI note-taking introduces automation and intelligent features to generate notes and make the process more efficient.
What’s the difference between AI note-taking, AI transcription, and AI summarization?
- AI note-taking: Involves using AI to assist in the process of creating and organizing notes. AI note-taking tools can help people capture, organize, and sometimes even generate notes. They may offer dynamic features such as voice-to-text, smart categorization, and contextual suggestions.
Dynamic note-taking has revolutionized how we capture and organize information. With dynamic AI notes, people can enjoy an interactive and efficient way to take notes. These AI-powered tools automatically categorize and highlight key points, making it easier to review and understand content later.
Using a productivity tool with AI built in offers more than just organization. It seamlessly integrates with other tools, enabling seamless collaboration and sharing. Imagine being able to instantly share your dynamic AI notes with colleagues, complete with AI-generated summaries and insights. This not only saves time but also ensures everyone is on the same page.
- Example: A project manager could use an AI note-taking solution to help them record and organize meeting notes in real time. This allows them to focus on the discussion without worrying about missing important details.
- AI transcription: Refers to converting spoken language into written text using AI. The AI transcription system uses speech recognition algorithms to transcribe spoken words into text. This can be beneficial for converting verbal content—such as meetings and interviews—into a written format for easy reference and analysis.
AI transcription tools often include features like speaker identification and timestamping, which make the transcribed text more useful. These features help you follow conversations and find specific information easily. As AI transcription technology improves, we can expect even better accuracy and more advanced features, making it a must-have tool for anyone needing reliable and efficient transcription services.
- Example: A department coordinator who takes minutes for a weekly meeting could use an AI transcription service to record accurate and efficient transcriptions of the speakers, saving time and enabling better accessibility to information.
- AI summarization: Involves using AI to generate concise and coherent summaries of longer texts or content. There are extractive summarization techniques (selecting and presenting existing sentences) and abstractive summarization techniques (generating new sentences to convey the summary).
AI summarization technology has revolutionized the way we process and understand large volumes of information. An AI summarizer can quickly condense lengthy documents, presentations, meetings, or reports into concise summaries, making it easier for users to grasp the key points without having to read through the entire content.
Not only can an AI summarizer extract the most relevant information, but it can also ensure that the summary is coherent and easy to understand. And as the demand for efficient information processing grows, the role of an AI summarizer is becoming increasingly important.
- Example: An individual who’s short on time could use an AI summarization service to distill the main points of a large research paper online.
AI note-taking helps people capture and organize their notes, AI transcription converts spoken language into written text, and AI summarization generates concise summaries of longer texts. Each application addresses specific needs in information management, offering efficiency and automation in various aspects of dealing with textual information.
Types of AI note-taking apps and transcription technology
- Speech-to-text technology: Many AI note-taking applications use speech-to-text technology to convert spoken words into written text. This allows people to dictate their notes verbally, and the AI system transcribes the speech into written form.
- Natural Language Processing (NLP): NLP is a key component in AI note-taking. The NLP algorithms can identify entities, relationships, and sentiments within the notes, making them easier to search and analyze.
- Contextual understanding: This technology can comprehend the context of notes—specific topics, for example—and enable more clear note-taking.
- Text summarization: Some AI note-taking tools offer automatic summarization features. Using machine learning (ML) techniques, the system can generate concise summaries of longer pieces of text, making it easier for people to review key points.
- Keyword extraction: AI algorithms can identify and extract important keywords or phrases from the notes. This aids in creating tags, categories, or metadata that enhance the organization and searchability of the notes.
- Image and handwriting recognition: Some AI note-taking applications can recognize and process images, diagrams, or handwritten notes. This expands the range of content that can be included in notes and makes them more versatile.
- Personalization and recommendations: AI can analyze patterns in a person’s note-taking behavior and preferences. Based on this analysis, the system may provide personalized recommendations, such as suggesting relevant content, tags, or formatting options.
- Collaboration and synchronization: AI-powered note-taking tools often support collaboration features. They can facilitate real-time collaboration by synchronizing notes across devices and people, allowing multiple individuals to work on and access the same set of notes.
- Integration with external platforms: AI note-taking tools may work with other platforms and services, such as calendars, task management tools, and cloud storage. This integration enhances the functionality of the note-taking system by providing a more comprehensive workspace.
- Continuous learning and improvement: AI models can be trained on feedback and usage patterns, allowing them to continuously improve and adapt to a person’s specific needs over time.
AI note-taking solutions vary in features and capabilities, but they use a combination of these techniques to enhance the effectiveness of note-taking processes.
5 benefits of AI note-taking and summarization apps
Here are several benefits of using these AI services:
- Time savings: AI-powered note-taking significantly reduces the time required to capture and organize information, freeing you up to focus on more important tasks.
- Increased productivity. Automating tasks like transcription and categorization allows for a more seamless workflow, enabling you to focus on conversations and valuable information in real time.
- Enhanced accessibility: The ability to access notes across various devices and platforms ensures that information is readily available for you and anyone else—whenever and wherever it’s needed.
- Improved organization: AI algorithms excel at organizing and categorizing information. The automated tagging and contextual understanding features of AI note-taking tools contribute to a more organized and structured knowledge bank.
- Personalized insights: AI can analyze patterns within notes to provide customized information. This can include recommendations for related content, identifying areas of focus, and even suggesting improvements in note-taking habits.
These tools are a boon for the modern, distributed workplace, and can help you more accurately record important notes and information.
